Method Detail

validateForPotentialMatch

public IStatus validateForPotentialMatch(Constraint constraint,
                                         DeployModelObject context)
Description copied from class: ConstraintValidator
This method is an alternative version of validation that is used when the constraint participates in some external matching process (e.g., hosting link matching). For example, Requirement Expression is validated differently during the proper validation process and during the validation that participates in the hosting/dependency link matching. Default implementation returns OK status. If this validator is NOT designed to validate the constraint, it should return CANCEL_STATUS (ConstraintValidator.CANCEL_STATUS).

Overrides:
validateForPotentialMatch in class ConstraintValidator
Parameters:
constraint - constraint to validate.
context - the context in which the constraint should be validated.
Returns:
validation status. If this validator is NOT designed to validate the constraint, it should return CANCEL_STATUS (ConstraintValidator.CANCEL_STATUS).
See Also:
validateForPotentialMatch(Constraint, DeployModelObject)

                        DeployModelObject context,

Validates the constraint. If this validator is NOT designed to validate the constraint, it should return CANCEL_STATUS (ConstraintValidator.CANCEL_STATUS).

See Also:

applicableConstraints

public java.util.List<ShortConstraintDescriptor> applicableConstraints(Constraint parentConstraint,
                                                                       java.util.List<ShortConstraintDescriptor> potentialConstraints)
Description copied from class: ConstraintValidator
The implementation should check that any of the potenital constraints can indeed be put as a child constraint of the given parentConstraint. It also checks the arity of child constraints and returns empty List (ConstraintValidator.EMPTY_CONSTRAINT_LIST) if no more children are allowed on the given constraint.

Overrides:
applicableConstraints in class ConstraintValidator
Parameters:
parentConstraint - the parent constraint
potentialConstraints - the list of potential constraints to be put as a child to this constraint
Returns:
the filterd list of potential child constraints, based on the abilities and preferences of the parentConstraint to have children; return value is a (non-strict) subset of 'potentialConstraints'

canValidateConstraint

public boolean canValidateConstraint(Constraint constraint)
Description copied from class: ConstraintValidator
Answers the question whether this Validator is designed to validate the constraint.

Specified by:
canValidateConstraint in class ConstraintValidator
Parameters:
constraint - constraint to validate.
Returns:
true or false

getContextForChildConstraints

public DeployModelObject getContextForChildConstraints(Constraint constraint)
Description copied from class: ConstraintValidator
The implementation should return the validation context DMO that the constraint will use to validate child constraints. Returns NULL, if this constraint validator can not validate this constraint instance, or if no child constraints are allowed. Validator should implement this method, but may call ConstraintValidator.getContextForChildConstraints_DefaultImpl(com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.Constraint) as a default implementation.

Overrides:
getContextForChildConstraints in class ConstraintValidator
Parameters:
constraint - the constraint that that is being asked
Returns:
returns the validation context DMO that the constraint will use to validate child constraints. Returns null, if this constraint validator can not validate this constraint or if no child constraints are allowed.

title

public java.lang.String title(Constraint constraint)
Description copied from class: ConstraintValidator
Returns the title of the specified constraint.

The constraint is passed as an argument because "this" is not a reliable mechanism for context due to import topologies.

Does not contextualize the constraint description with the title of its child constraints.

Overrides:
title in class ConstraintValidator
Parameters:
constraint - the constraint whose title should be returned.
Returns:
the constraint title.
See Also:
ConstraintValidator.titleWithContext(Constraint)
